channel.title: The world of the conductor
channel.description:
A series of interviews with leading symphonic conductors about aspects of symphonic music and their profession.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Kletzki on Mahler
item.description: Paul Kletzki on Gustav Mahler.
item.dc:creator: WHYY (Radio station : Philadelphia, Pa.)
item.dc:subject: Mahler, Gustav, 1860-1911

item.title: Mozart, Brahms and singers
item.description: In this program, Erich Leinsdorf talks about Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Johannes Brahms and singers.
item.dc:creator: WHYY (Radio station : Philadelphia, Pa.)
item.dc:subject: Brahms, Johannes, 1833-1897.

item.title: Conductor as music historian, part 1
item.description: This program features Ernest Ansermet and Erich Leinsdorf talking about the conductor as historian of music.
item.dc:creator: WHYY (Radio station : Philadelphia, Pa.)
item.dc:subject: Conductors (Music)

item.title: Orchestral styles
item.description: Orchestral styles with Eugene Ormandy, Leopold Stokowski and Igor Markevitch.
item.dc:creator: WHYY (Radio station : Philadelphia, Pa.)
item.dc:subject: Conductors (Music)

item.title: Conductor as recording artist, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, explores the concept of the conductor as a recording artist, with Erich Leinsdort, Ernest Ansermet and Igor Markevitch.
item.dc:creator: WHYY (Radio station : Philadelphia, Pa.)
item.dc:subject: Conductors (Music)
